title: Phrasal Verbs
description: Слушайте фразовые глаголы в реальных контекстах.

tasks.audioText: My colleague was really struggling with the workload. He almost gave up on the project before the deadline.
tasks.transcript: He almost gave up on the project before the deadline.

options.text: He nearly quit the project before it was due.
He finished the project ahead of schedule.
He gave the project to someone else.
He started a new project before the deadline.

tasks.explanation: 'Gave up' means to stop trying or quit. He nearly abandoned the project due to difficulty.

tasks.audioText: My grandmother has always been incredibly kind. She looked after all of us when we were children.
tasks.transcript: She looked after all of us when we were children.

options.text: She searched for us when we were kids.
She took care of all of us during our childhood.
She looked at us from a distance.
She left us alone when we were young.

tasks.explanation: 'Looked after' means to take care of or tend to someone. Grandmother cared for them as children.

tasks.audioText: The manager offered him a promotion, but surprisingly he turned it down without any hesitation.
tasks.transcript: He turned it down without any hesitation.

options.text: He accepted the promotion immediately.
He refused the offer without thinking twice.
He turned around and left the office.
He asked for more time to decide.

tasks.explanation: 'Turned down' means to reject or decline an offer. He refused the promotion right away.

tasks.audioText: I was tidying up my attic last weekend. I came across some old letters from my university days.
tasks.transcript: I came across some old letters from my university days.

options.text: I found some old letters unexpectedly while cleaning.
I wrote some letters to my university friends.
I threw away all the old letters.
I crossed out the letters with a pen.

tasks.explanation: 'Came across' means to find something by chance. The letters were discovered accidentally during cleaning.

tasks.audioText: We were supposed to go hiking this Saturday. Unfortunately, the trip has been put off until next month due to bad weather.
tasks.transcript: The trip has been put off until next month due to bad weather.

options.text: The hiking trip was postponed to next month because of the weather.
The trip was cancelled permanently.
They went hiking despite the bad weather.
The trip started earlier than planned.

tasks.explanation: 'Put off' means to postpone or delay. The trip was rescheduled to a later date.

tasks.audioText: The detective spent months investigating the case. He finally figured out who was behind the whole scheme.
tasks.transcript: He finally figured out who was behind the whole scheme.

options.text: He eventually discovered the person responsible for the plan.
He imagined who the criminal might be.
He gave up on solving the case.
He figured the case was too difficult to solve.

tasks.explanation: 'Figured out' means to solve or understand something. The detective identified the mastermind after long investigation.

tasks.audioText: The company is doing well this quarter. Revenue has picked up significantly since the launch of the new product line.
tasks.transcript: Revenue has picked up significantly since the launch of the new product line.

options.text: Sales income has increased noticeably after the new products were released.
Revenue dropped after the product launch.
Someone collected the revenue from the office.
The new product line was cancelled.

tasks.explanation: 'Picked up' means to improve or increase. Revenue grew after the new product line launched.

tasks.audioText: My phone battery died in the middle of the call. I need to find a charger so I can carry on with the conversation.
tasks.transcript: I need to find a charger so I can carry on with the conversation.

options.text: I want to continue the call after charging my phone.
I want to end the conversation permanently.
I will carry the charger to someone else.
I don't need a charger for my phone.

tasks.explanation: 'Carry on' means to continue doing something. The speaker wants to resume the call.

tasks.audioText: The children were excited when we arrived at the farm. They couldn't wait to find out what kind of animals lived there.
tasks.transcript: They couldn't wait to find out what kind of animals lived there.

options.text: They were eager to discover which animals were at the farm.
They already knew all the animals on the farm.
They found the animals outside the farm.
They didn't want to see any animals.

tasks.explanation: 'Find out' means to learn or discover information. The children wanted to learn about the farm animals.

tasks.audioText: Sarah felt overwhelmed after her first week at the new school. Fortunately, the other students helped her settle in quickly.
tasks.transcript: The other students helped her settle in quickly.

options.text: The students helped her sit down in the classroom.
Her classmates made her feel comfortable and adjusted in the new environment.
She settled a dispute with the other students.
The students ignored her during her first week.

tasks.explanation: 'Settle in' means to become comfortable in a new place or situation. Her classmates eased her transition.

tasks.audioText: The meeting ran much longer than expected. We didn't get through all the items on the agenda.
tasks.transcript: We didn't get through all the items on the agenda.

options.text: We completed every topic on the agenda successfully.
We failed to cover all the planned discussion points.
We threw away the agenda before the meeting.
We got through the door before the meeting started.

tasks.explanation: 'Get through' means to finish or complete something. They couldn't cover all the planned topics.

tasks.audioText: The old factory at the end of the street is being demolished. They are going to pull it down and build a community centre.
tasks.transcript: They are going to pull it down and build a community centre.

options.text: They plan to demolish the factory and construct a community space in its place.
They will pull the factory to a different location.
They are renovating the factory to make it bigger.
They will build the community centre next to the factory.

tasks.explanation: 'Pull down' means to demolish or tear down a building. The factory will be destroyed and replaced.

tasks.audioText: The doctor told me to cut down on sugary drinks. She said it would improve my overall health significantly.
tasks.transcript: The doctor told me to cut down on sugary drinks.

options.text: The doctor advised me to reduce the amount of sweet beverages I consume.
The doctor told me to stop eating sugar completely.
The doctor cut some drinks with scissors.
The doctor recommended drinking more sugary drinks.

tasks.explanation: 'Cut down on' means to reduce the quantity or frequency of something. The advice was to drink fewer sugary beverages.

tasks.audioText: The fire alarm went off in the middle of the exam. All students had to leave the building immediately.
tasks.transcript: The fire alarm went off in the middle of the exam.

options.text: The fire alarm was activated during the exam.
The fire alarm was turned off during the exam.
Someone went to check the fire alarm after the exam.
The fire alarm went away from the building.

tasks.explanation: 'Went off' for an alarm means it started ringing or sounding. The alarm was triggered during the test.

tasks.audioText: The conference speaker was very engaging. She brought up an interesting point about artificial intelligence in modern healthcare.
tasks.transcript: She brought up an interesting point about artificial intelligence in modern healthcare.

options.text: She raised a thought-provoking topic about AI in healthcare during her talk.
She brought an AI device up to the stage.
She avoided discussing artificial intelligence entirely.
She brought up her children during the conference.

tasks.explanation: 'Brought up' means to mention or introduce a topic in conversation. She raised the subject of AI in healthcare.
